frameDefinitions: A specified Designer or a Brand creates and distributes a Collection of related Products.
The absolute Value of a quantifiable Attribute  of an item is determined by adding up the values for the Attribute of the individuals or parts that make up the item.
A Cognizer has carried out an approximate calculation or considered some Evidence and produced an approximation of the Value of a feature of an Item.
A Cognizer computes a Result on the basis of input Numbers by addition.
A Cognizer carries out an approximate calculation or considers some Evidence so as to arrive at an approximate Value for some Feature of an Item.
This frame contains transparent nouns (and some adjectives) denoting quantities of a Mass or of Individuals.
frameExamples: The new Gucci <t>line</t> is due out in early Spring.
Defence is provided in West Germany by armed forces whose number <t>totals</t> close to half a million men and women
You can list a <t><fex name='Value'>ballpark figure</fex></t> for shipping and handling.
Until 1971, dolphin mortality could be <t>estimated</t> only from analyses of vessels ' logbooks -- and the figures are probably underestimates. CNI
He found them in the <t>deluge</t> of papers on his desk.
listRoleDefinitions: The company that produces the <fen>Collection</fen> of <fen>Products</fen>.
The set of <fen>Products</fen> produced by the <fen>Brand</fen>.
The individual items produced by the <fen>Brand</fen>.
The person who designs the <fen>Collection</fen>.
The value of an attribute.
The scalar property of a concrete or abstract entity.
A set of numbers that add up to the <fen>Value</fen>.
The individual who has considered evidence or performed calculations to produce the approximation.
The position or area  on the feature scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has concluded the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The entity that possesses a feature whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated.
A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a feature's <fen>Value</fen>.
An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> formed the estimate.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has formed their estimate.
The person doing the calculation.
The <fen>Numbers</fen> that are used in the calculation.
The outcome of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s calculcations.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> operates on the <fen>Numbers</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> performs their calculation
The individual who considers evidence or performs calculations to arrive at an approximation.
The feature is a scalar property of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The position or area  on the <fen>Feature</fen> scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> concludes the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The entity that possesses the <fen>Feature</fen> whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate.
A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms the estimate of the <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms their estimate.
The <fen>Quantity</fen>-denoting <t>Target</t> word.
A substance that is being quantified.
A collection of entities.
